climbs.name: Tall Blonde Man With One Green Shoe

content.protection: 8 bolts plus a two bolt anchor
content.location: Right most bolted line on the northwest face.

content.description: climb the bolt line up the shallow concavity
content.location: E side of the S face

climbs.name: Cereal Killer
climbs.fa: Jacob Valdez and Bill McMann circa 1990

content.description: A very fun climb that starts mellow and then has a thin crux on steeper terrain starting at about the second bolt. Think outside the box for several moves and then gain a good rest on bigger crystals. Fight for a few more hard sequences that end up on good rests until you reach a small roof. This route gets really fantastic when you use an undercling to gain a super fun sequence of small, delicate holds to the anchors. Highly repeatable and a great warm up for the five twelves on both sides of it.
content.location: Middle route on the north side of the Cornflake formation.

content.description: Climb the thin bulge to the left of Cereal Killer.   If you are looking for a 5.12 route with only one 5.12 move then this is it.  It can be top roped after topping Cereal Killer
content.location: Left most bolted line on the northwest face.

content.description: A neat fin of rock just north of Duckbill. The furthest north of the other formations. Hard climbing good formation for the 5.12 climber. Cornflake is a 5.9+X by Dennis Horning and Henry Barber. Cereal Killer 5.10 is the most popular on this formation. This formation is in line that forms 3 spire / flakes. Including Kara and Duckbill. Cornflake is more of a flake when looking for it. The other two are more formation spires.
